alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Beaverhead County through 500 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles northwest of Lima, or 33 miles southwest of Dillon, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Beaverhead County. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 26 and 44 . MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Additionally, this storm is following a similar path to a storm that recently moved through the area, which already produced up to an inch of rainfall as it fell. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southwestern Montana.
